comments: General rate durations for various bars and boosts:
This 'comments' field is for reference only, ignored by the game and not saved.

events.description: To determine the rate: 1. Multiply by the BSF. 2. Multiply by Green Bar Boost I. 3. For every Green Bar Boost II, press the button to multiply by Boost II Factor. With this result, in Green Bar setup, set Gain per Batch for the Ambient Energy recipe.
events.name: Green Bar Rate

events.description: To determine the rate: 1. Multiply by the BSF. 2. Multiply by Red Bar Boost I. 3. For every Red Bar Boost II, multiply by Boost II Factor (press the button that many times). Then go to Red Bar setup (shift+click on PC to leave window open). Set Gain per Batch for the Ambient Energy recipe to this result.
events.name: Red Bar Rate

events.description: To determine the rate: 1. Multiply by the BSF. 2. Multiply by Yellow Bar Boost I. 3. For every Yellow Bar Boost II, press the button to multiply by Boost II Factor. With this result, go to Yellow Bar setup and set Gain per Batch.
events.name: Yellow Bar Rate

items.description: Rate amount +0.5 each.
items.name: Green Bar Boost I

items.description: Gain per batch 1 each. See Red Bar Rate for how to perform the upgrade (also linked below).
items.name: Red Bar Boost I

items.description:
Rate amount x1.5 Multiplying for each upgrade means the total benefit is exponential, so with a base rate amount of 20 from all Red Bar Boost I upgrades, the rate amount becomes: 
20 * 1.5 ^ 6 = 228
items.name: Red Bar Boost II

items.description: Binds colors together into patterned objects.
items.name: Sticky Force

items.description:
Combine light to produce this secondary color. 
 _____________
/____________/
items.name: 🟨Yellow Bar

items.description:
An especially vibrant color. 
 _____________
/____________/
items.name: 🟧Orange Bar

items.description:
At first, indeterminate flashes of energy are the only thing distinguishable from nothingness. The energy seems unlimited. Maybe it even is. 

        |
<*>   -<*>-   *
        |
items.name: Ambient Energy

items.description: Rate amount +1
items.name: White Bar Boost I

items.description:
At the end of the visible spectrum. 
 _____________
/____________/
items.name: 🟪Violet Bar

items.description: Soil that holds its form, land. While earth does reach the planet's center, so does water, with tunnels, caverns and outcroppings in the depths. Both surface and depths include areas covered by earth roughly equal in size to those of water.
items.name: Earth

items.description: Loosely-knit atmosphere surrounding the planet, a firmament to displace the emptiness of space. About as big as the volume of earth and water combined.
items.name: Air

items.description: Roots push deep into the earth, a mighty trunk stands tall, branches spread toward the heavens, and leaves drink sunlight. World Tree... Tree of Life... Tree of Knowledge... wisdom, connection, growth
items.name: Tree

items.description: The beginning of something greater. Place it just underneath the surface of the land.
items.name: Seed

items.description: Rate amount +1
items.name: Black Bar Boost I

items.description:
It seems like you shouldn't be able to see a black bar in space. Doesn't black absorb all light?
  _____________
//____________//
Requires a reset: 1. Stop producing the sources of this item (#, #, #). 2. Produce as many black bars as possible. 3. Set quantities of the sources to 0. 4. Reset rates and boosts of # (1/8s, I, II) and # (0.5/8s, I, II). PC browser shortcuts: Ctrl+Click to open multiple tabs, Alt+LeftArrow to go back.
items.name: ⬛Black Bar

items.description:
Mix all other wavelengths for the pinnacle of light combination, the seventh. 
 _____________
/____________/
items.name: ⬜White Bar

items.description: Rate amount +1 each.
items.name: Yellow Bar Boost I

items.description: Rate amount +0.5
items.name: Blue Bar Boost I

items.description:
Rate amount x1.5 
Total: 10 * 1.5 ^ 6 = 114
items.name: Yellow Bar Boost II

items.description: No waiting required, but struggles to keep pace once upgrades start coming in.
items.name: Attentively Collected Beam

items.description: Rate amount +1
items.name: Orange Bar Boost I

items.description: Enables the reaction of grouped colors to generate energy.
items.name: Fire Force

items.description: Weave black light into an intricate, structured fabric that underlies and supports the universe.
items.name: Black Fabric

items.description: It's wet! And inconstant, shifting. Bind blue light together tightly in regular amounts.
items.name: Water

items.description: Required for living beings such as plants. Creating this force will consume all remaining ambient energy.
items.name: Life Force

items.description:
Gather blue wavelengths of light.

 _____________
/____________/
items.name: 🟦Blue Bar

items.description: Loosely pulls colors together, effectively separating them into large collections. Order black fabric in a texture that defines this force. When completed: • Configure this location to check Show in Overview.
items.name: Gravity Force

items.description:
Rate amount x1.5 This means increasing by 50% each, exponentially. So, the green bar rate with all boosts I and II is: 
5 * 1.5 ^ 6 = 57 per 8 seconds
items.name: Green Bar Boost II

items.description:
Shape green wavelengths into a form, a rectangular prism. Quantity describes the length from one end to the other. 
 _____________
/____________/
items.name: 🟩Green Bar

items.description: Gigantic heat-generating sphere on a scale that even imagining threatens to overwhelm the mind. After constructing: • Configure this location to unmask and show in Overview. • Hide the Local Solar System from Overview by unchecking the box. • For bar recipes that use this item (listed below), update gain per batch to 100 multiplied by BSF.
items.name: Star

items.description: For each boost II, multiply the rate by this fixed value. With a calculator, for example with 6 boost II upgrades, the formula is 1.5 ^ 6 = 11.39. Or, with event aids, press the button 6 times.
items.name: Boost II Factor

items.description: Weave red light into an early, basic fabric that underlies and supports the universe. So named because it comes from red light, not because it has a color of its own.
items.name: Red Fabric

items.description:
Select red wavelengths. Creating the first bar of light marks the start of meaningful time, the first different state. 

 _____________
/____________/
items.name: 🟥Red Bar

items.description: Supports three-dimensional space so that things can be in different places. Everything else in physics depends on spacetime, including interactions like gravity. Note: While this could be seen as playing God, I prefer to think of the player role in this scenario as an observer, with apparent choices actually predestined.
items.name: Distance Force

items.description:
Set this quantity (BSF) to a multiplier such as: 
0.5   : slow
1     : normal — no change
2     : somewhat faster
10    : fast
100   : practically no idling — incremental only
You'll be using this to multiply gains for bars and elements, starting with Red Bar Gain. For upgrades and other low-quantity items, you can reduce recipe durations according to the table below, generally 5% less per BSF. Minimum duration 1 second. 
BSF    rate multiplier
---    ---------------
0.5    10% more
1      no change
2      10% less
4      20% less
5      25% less
8      40% less
10     50% less
items.name: 🏁Base Speed Factor

locations.description: Ever new possibilities present themselves as we begin to see what the Sticky Force can do in this place, Terra. Rather than cosmically large and powerful, things here are of lesser scale but beautiful.
locations.name: Planet

locations.description: An area designated to hold a star orbited by celestial bodies.
locations.name: Local Solar System

overall.description:
Form <c="#FF0000">c</c><c="#FF6600">o</c><c="#CC9900">l</c><c="#CCCC00">o</c><c="#99CC00">r</c><c="#66CC00">f</c><c="#0099CC">u</c><c="#0000FF">l</c> rectangular prisms at the beginning of space and time.

Complete set of items and instructions. Upgrade rates by changing settings.

overall.title: Rays
